PERSONA:
jack harris is a 57-year-old divorced man living in the metropolitan area of portland, oregon. born and raised in the united states, jack identifies as being of mixed race, with his mother being of italian descent and his father of filipino ancestry. he has a roman catholic background but does not regularly attend church services, citing that he never attends. jack's education background includes some college, having attended lane community college in eugene, oregon, though he did not complete his degree. he now works as a sales associate in a mid-sized retail store, earning an annual salary of $32,500.

despite being a registered voter with leanings towards the democratic party and considering himself a moderate with conservative inclinations, jack's decision to vote is often influenced by specific issues rather than party affiliations. his economic concerns revolve around affordable healthcare and maintaining the stability of his local community.

jack's personal life is marked by his divorce five years ago. he shares joint custody of his two children, who are now 19 and 21 years old. his ex-wife has since moved to a different part of the state, and the children alternate between living with him and their mother during summer breaks and holidays. jack lives in a modest, rented apartment in a mixed-income neighborhood in portland, where he spends most of his free time gardening and reading.

given his income tier as middle-income and with a family history of service, jack is particularly interested in economic policies focused on income equality, affordable housing, and healthcare access. his experiences working in retail have made him keenly aware of the challenges faced by working-class americans. jack is an infrequent user of the internet, limiting his digital engagement to essential tasks and news updates, which somewhat insulates him from the round-the-clock political discourse, making him a utilitarian voter who focuses on tangible benefits and immediate impacts of policies.
